description: Complete 30 Clean and Jerk reps as fast as possible.

cleanTechniqueSteps.description: Begin with the barbell on the floor, standing with feet hip-width apart and toes slightly angled outwards. Ensure even weight distribution across your feet. Grip the barbell with a clean grip. Keep back arched, shoulders back, elbows outwards, head forward.
With hips slightly higher than knees, push through your legs and stand up, maintaining the back angle until the bar reaches mid-thigh.
Continue pushing aggressively against the floor, extending hips and knees explosively while keeping the barbell close to your body.
When fully extended, jump and slide feet out to squat stance. Simultaneously, shrug shoulders and bring elbows high and wide to pull the barbell up.
Quickly bring elbows to the front of the body and elevate them as you descend into a full squat, creating a clean-rack position.
Allow downward momentum and barbell weight to guide you into a full squat, then rebound upwards to standing position.

jerkTechniqueSteps.description: Adjust the barbell on your shoulder to preferred jerk rack position. Take a deep breath, brace core, and shift weight to heels.
With a vertical torso, bend knees and drive legs against the ground to create vertical momentum for the barbell.
After full extension, push beneath the barbell with arms and jump feet into split receiving position, catching the barbell overhead with fully locked arms.
Stabilize the barbell overhead and recover to a fully standing position, remembering to recover with the front foot first.
